snippet.textDisplay:
2x 2.3ghz at 8cores is still not much sorry.

Also M.2 drives aren’t that new and are pretty cheap and not that super advanced.

We all know how the Mac can turned out so I’m curious to see how thermals tuen out.

Backwards compatibility isn’t a big thing we’ve had direct X and have been able to do these things for a long time.

120 FPS isn’t even that much and 8k screens are still in development and is a very new thing. Looking back on the one x it will probably be upscaled.

Also do you know how thermal work..... once again the Mac-Can, that 1 fan only blowing will not be a good thing.

And how can you say share buttons are new but M.2 ssd are they have exited for about the same amount of time!


But can your beautiful new console play online game without having to pay a subscription?

I think not!
snippet.textOriginal:
2x 2.3ghz at 8cores is still not much sorry.

Also M.2 drives aren’t that new and are pretty cheap and not that super advanced.

We all know how the Mac can turned out so I’m curious to see how thermals tuen out.

Backwards compatibility isn’t a big thing we’ve had direct X and have been able to do these things for a long time.

120 FPS isn’t even that much and 8k screens are still in development and is a very new thing. Looking back on the one x it will probably be upscaled.

Also do you know how thermal work..... once again the Mac-Can, that 1 fan only blowing will not be a good thing.

And how can you say share buttons are new but M.2 ssd are they have exited for about the same amount of time!


But can your beautiful new console play online game without having to pay a subscription?

I think not!

snippet.textDisplay:
No way is this Xbox gonna be able to run Ray tracing and 8k. Y'all realize that computers that cost 5+ grand can barely run 4k and Ray tracing at decent FPS? The only way this is gonna happen is if it cost a shit ton of money and obviously it's not going to be because they want regular people buying it. There is something they are not telling us. I guarantee their 8k claim is gonna be 8k* with some bullshit marketing scheme.

For reference, I just bought a brand new $1000 computer, I got the best components possible for that price, just for hardware, not the keyboard monitor or mouse, and I can barely run 4k at 30-40fps depending on the game and that's not including Ray tracing. This has bullshit written all over it.
snippet.textOriginal:
No way is this Xbox gonna be able to run Ray tracing and 8k. Y'all realize that computers that cost 5+ grand can barely run 4k and Ray tracing at decent FPS? The only way this is gonna happen is if it cost a shit ton of money and obviously it's not going to be because they want regular people buying it. There is something they are not telling us. I guarantee their 8k claim is gonna be 8k* with some bullshit marketing scheme.

For reference, I just bought a brand new $1000 computer, I got the best components possible for that price, just for hardware, not the keyboard monitor or mouse, and I can barely run 4k at 30-40fps depending on the game and that's not including Ray tracing. This has bullshit written all over it.

snippet.textDisplay:
just a little info for everyone who dosent know, AMD actually makes the GPU and CPU chips for both xbox and playstation as far as i know... and im pretty sure scarlett will actually run off of one of amds APU chips (GPU and CPU hybrid for those who dont know) (they only make the chips tho the rest is up to the manufacturer whether that be playstation or xbox)
EDIT: just wanna correct myself that AMD actually just assists in the making of the chips with their architecture etc (some things are actually made purely by the console manufacturer)
snippet.textOriginal:
just a little info for everyone who dosent know, AMD actually makes the GPU and CPU chips for both xbox and playstation as far as i know... and im pretty sure scarlett will actually run off of one of amds APU chips (GPU and CPU hybrid for those who dont know) (they only make the chips tho the rest is up to the manufacturer whether that be playstation or xbox)

snippet.textDisplay:
Your before you buy list is weak. This is the actual list of things people want to know about the new Xbox.

1). With the Xbox one you cannot use any of your xbox 360 controllers and adapters on it. But you can use them on you windows 10 pc.
2). Is your Kinect able to plug right in , or do you have to buy a $50 plus adapter to use it on the new Xbox?

3) is is straight disc play with the backwards compatibility, or do you have to download 2 to 150 gigs of a drm game from Microsoft and then use the disc to play?
4). Price of the console?
5) is Microsoft still going to make you have an Xbox gold account to transfer your saved games files from your previous Xbox consoles? Because it was required for the Xbox 360 and Xbox one.
6). The size of the hard? That hard drive will fill up super quickly.
7). Is Microsoft going to deny people the ability to put music on their Xbox hard drive like they did with the Xbox one.
8). Is it 3D and HDR compatible out of the box or do you have to download an update again?
9). Do all the functions for the console need to be downloaded and installed as an app before we can actually use the console ? We needed to download an app to play blu-ray and dvd movies

10). Is Microsoft gonna gouge is on digital prices on the App Store.?

11). Will all my digital games that didn’t come to backwards compatibility on the Xbox one from my Xbox 360 automatically install on the new Xbox? Because I don’t want to hear some Donkey excuse telling us “it is up to the publisher or developer of the game to contact Xbox and tell us it is okay for Xbox to let games people own be playable on the new console” 🤦‍♂️

12). Is the console going to have actual games for it, or is it going to be a bunch of digital shovel ware and digital Xbox 360 & original Xbox games?
snippet.textOriginal:
Your before you buy list is weak. This is the actual list of things people want to know about the new Xbox. 

1). With the Xbox one you cannot use any of your xbox 360 controllers and adapters on it. But you can use them on you windows 10 pc. 
2). Is your Kinect able to plug right in , or do you have to buy a $50 plus adapter to use it on the new Xbox?

3) is is straight disc play with the backwards compatibility, or do you have to download 2 to 150 gigs of a drm game from Microsoft and then use the disc to play? 
4). Price of the console?
5) is Microsoft still going to make you have an Xbox gold account to transfer your saved games files from your previous Xbox consoles? Because it was required for the Xbox 360 and Xbox one. 
6). The size of the hard?  That hard drive will fill up super quickly. 
7). Is Microsoft going to deny people the ability to put music on their Xbox hard drive like they did with the Xbox one. 
8). Is it 3D and HDR compatible  out of the box or do you have to download an update again? 
9). Do all the functions for the console need to be downloaded and installed as an app before we can actually use the console ? We needed to download an app to play blu-ray and dvd movies

10). Is Microsoft gonna gouge is on digital prices on the App Store.?

11). Will all my digital games that didn’t come to backwards compatibility on the Xbox one from my Xbox 360 automatically install on the new Xbox? Because I don’t want to hear some Donkey excuse telling us “it is up to the publisher or developer of the game to contact Xbox and tell us it is okay for Xbox to let games people own be playable on the new console” 🤦‍♂️ 

12). Is the console going to have actual games for it, or is it going to be a bunch of digital shovel ware and digital Xbox 360 & original Xbox games?

snippet.textDisplay: Stated in release vid by Phill claims that the console is 3 controllers high. what he didn't mention after fully studying the images released is that the new controller is infact around half to a full inch shorter than the current controllers as the measurement of the disc drive stays the same which is 5.45 to 5.5 inches long / tall which is how I found out that the controller is smaller ( for all the na sayers). This puts the console around 11 inches to 12 inches tall. And as an added note the design is like a cylo and likely has rounded corners inside so that the fan mounted on the top cool the system like a cyclone which in my opinion makes perfect sense to keep this console cool.
snippet.textOriginal: Stated in release vid by Phill claims that the console is 3 controllers high. what he didn't mention after fully studying the images released is that the new controller is infact around half to a full inch shorter than the current controllers as the measurement of the disc drive stays the same which is 5.45 to 5.5 inches long / tall which is how I found out that the controller is smaller ( for all the na sayers). This puts the console around 11 inches to 12 inches tall. And as an added note the design is like a cylo and likely has rounded corners inside so that the fan mounted on the top cool the system like a cyclone which in my opinion makes perfect sense to keep this console cool.

snippet.textDisplay:
One question why vertical?

Despite what the commercials shows but Xbox's have issues working while being vertical and I know this first hand when I got my first 360 I tried to play it vertical like you see on the commercials and unfortunately when it was vertical it literally destroyed my Halo 3 and I had to get another one.

Lesson learned
snippet.textOriginal:
One question why vertical? 

Despite what the commercials shows but Xbox's have issues working while being vertical and I know this first hand when I got my first 360 I tried to play it vertical like you see on the commercials and unfortunately when it was vertical it literally destroyed my Halo 3 and I had to get another one.

Lesson learned
